info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 11:53AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne County through 1230 PM EDT... At 1153 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Detroit Zoo, or near Warren, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grosse Pointe, Downtown Detroit and Belle Isle around 1210 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Northeast Detroit, Highland Park, Northwest Detroit, Harper Woods, Grosse Pointe Shores, Southwest Detroit, Hamtramck, River Rouge, Grosse Pointe Woods and Grosse Pointe Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
